programmes.show_description: (1996) Peter Jackson's comedy horror stars Michael J Fox as a psychic investigator in a town that has more ghouls and ghosties than you can shake a spirit stick at. But is he a fraud?
(2020) Groundhog day shoot 'em up with Frank Grillo, Naomi Watts and Mel Gibson. Ray gets killed every day. Can he escape by unravelling the mystery of why a bunch of people want him dead?
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
(1942) Ginger Rogers stars in this comedy of romantic misadventure. A woman poses as a girl to get a cheap rail fare. But things get awkward when she falls for a man who helps her out.
(1995) Romantic drama based on Arthurian legend, starring Richard Gere, Sean Connery and Julia Ormond. Can nomadic swordsman Lancelot contain his love for King Arthur's fiancée?
(2019) Adventure comedy sequel with Dwayne Johnson, Jack Black, Kevin Hart and Karen Gillan. The old school pals enter the Jumanji video game again to save their friend.
(2015) Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance star in Steven Spielberg's Cold War spy drama. After gaining notoriety for defending a Soviet spy, a US lawyer then tries to free a CIA pilot.
Director Steven Spielberg and stars Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance talk about making their Cold War espionage drama.
(2006) Pulsating sci-fi action with Denzel Washington and Val Kilmer. An AFT agent uses new technology to reach back in time, stop a ferry bombing, and save the love of his life. Simple.
(2022) Michael Bay's high-octane thriller with Jake Gyllenhaal. After a bodged heist, two brothers try to evade the LAPD in an ambulance, while a paramedic operates on a cop in the back.
(2019) Oliver Laxe's psychological drama follows Amador, a convicted arsonist, as he returns home from prison to his small community. In Galician and Spanish/subs.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Four children compete in two crafty upcycling challenges working with recycled wood. Only two will make it through to the semi finals of Crafty Champions. (Ep1)
Teleshopping.
(1966) Western with Maureen O'Hara and James Stewart. With the help of a drifter, a widow strives to fulfil her husband's last wish to introduce rare cattle to the perilous American west.
(1957) Western. A Union army deserter sets out to turn his Texan hometown's womenfolk into sharpshooters in order to repel a Comanche attack. Starring Audie Murphy and Kathryn Grant.
(1949) Western. Gregory Peck plays the leader of an outlaw gang whose plans to rob an old man and his granddaughter of their gold go seriously awry. With Anne Baxter and Richard Widmark.
(1951) Classic Ealing comedy starring Alec Guinness as a mild-mannered bank clerk who assembles a gang to hijack a million quid's worth of gold. Which is when their problems really start...
(2019) Greta Gerwig's Oscar-winning period drama adaptation of the classic Louisa May Alcott novel, starring Emma Watson, Saoirse Ronan, Florence Pugh, Timothée Chalamet and Meryl Streep.
(2022) Horror with Ralph Fiennes and Anya Taylor-Joy. Only one diner at an exclusive eatery sees through the foam quenelles to the pile of steaming prairie oysters beyond. Mayhem ensues.
